Keywords: Amazon , Armor , Future , Warrior
Real Name: Diana
Special Powers
80 YEARS OF WONDER WOMAN: Wonder Woman has [Wonder Woman Ally team ability] and may start the game with any Wonder Woman Equipment equipped.
DEFENDER OF THE INNOCENT: Wonder Woman starts the game with 3 Fortified tokens. Each time Wonder Woman rolls for the [Kingdom Come team ability] or [Wonder Woman team ability], give her X Fortified tokens where X is the result of her roll. // FREE: Remove any number of Fortified tokens to modify defense +X until your next turn where X is the number of Fortified tokens removed.

April 27, 2021
pokolo
Man, I used to own this figure way back in the day, but i traded most of my pre-carded stuff away including her cos I nvr thought she’d b playable again... low and behold!
March 29, 2021
Dortmuner
[QUOTE=SpaceTitanium;12126111]the golden armor helps her take A hit, but after she takes another she's sitting at the stats of a figure a third her cost and only gets worse from there. Her greatest strength is dial length and even that is eroded by how long some low cost dials are with the same reducers and better performance all around. Thought the KC WW mentioned for the legacy card was going to be the WF figure, which has held up remarkably well for it's age[/QUOTE] She starts off with 3 Fortified tokens. So she can give herself a 21 DV for one turn or a 19 for three straight turns. When they try to hit her, assuming they beat her 19-21 or she's lost it, at the least she will roll for SS from WW TA, giving her 1 to 6 more Fortified tokens, whether she succeeds or not. If they're charging at her or making a close HSS attack, she's also rolling for KC TA for another 1 to 6 tokens. If she happens to succeed her roll, she takes no damage and has enough tokens to bump DV +1 for six straight turns or +3 two turns. If she gets hit first turn, if she has the Golden Armor, she's taking max 1 damage and then bumps her DV up to 19-21, depending on her rolls. She'll have an average of 3 tokens every time someone swings at her and beats her DV. You should be able to judiciously dole out the tokens to keep her at +1 defense every turn and, depending on how well you roll and how well you anticipate attacks, will probably be able to have her at +2 to +3 defense a fair amount of time. You have to be careful about when you use more than one token, but I think she's got some longevity built in if she uses the armor. Swarm teams are going to give her a ton of tokens just trying to get to her. She's got a 12-13 attack for 4-6 damage for 5 clicks. Then 2 clicks of 11 attack for 4-5 damage, with one of those clicks being Flurry. She's largely useless her last 3 clicks, but even a 9 or 8 attack is going to hit every now and then with Flurry. She's overcosted, but I think she'll be fun to play in some casual games.
March 29, 2021
SpaceTitanium
the golden armor helps her take A hit, but after she takes another she's sitting at the stats of a figure a third her cost and only gets worse from there. Her greatest strength is dial length and even that is eroded by how long some low cost dials are with the same reducers and better performance all around. Thought the KC WW mentioned for the legacy card was going to be the WF figure, which has held up remarkably well for it's age
